text: yesterday an attack a bombing of a
government center here and a shooting
attack at a nearby island getaway four
children left at least 92 people dead
I spent the day talking to victims of
the attack on the island called Anaya
trying to piece together what had
occurred witnesses said that there were
about 600 campers between the ages of 14
and 30 on the island at the time of the
shooting most were gathered in a Maine
Assembly Building in the main part of
the island to hear news about the
bombing that had occurred a short time
earlier in Oslo many of the children of
prominent political families and were
worried that relatives could have been
caught up in the violence in Oslo some
of the witnesses said many said they
heard shots before they saw a gunman as
soon as the gunman who police have
identified as 32 year old under the
Breivik began shooting many said they
simply ran in all directions tumbling
down rocky hills and a desperate attempt
to make it to the see the shooter
proceeded calmly the witnesses said
methodically aiming at those who were
swimming one witness Helen Anderson a 21
year old political adviser on the camp
said that several people who have been
swimming in the water around her were
shot and killed she described him as
taking his time aiming and shooting she
said it was a slaughter of young people
even after the shooting began witnesses
said mr. Brabeck the shooter was able to
coax young people out of hiding because
many thought he was a police officer
dressed in uniform once they revealed
themselves to him however the witnesses
said he opened fire again and again the
camp which has been held for decades by
the youth wing of the country's dominant
Labor Party is the event of the year for
many campers it is a rite of passage for
the country's liberal elite and many of
the country's current leaders have
expressed fond memories of their time
there though many of the witnesses I
spoke with said that they had been
reunited with their family they said
that they knew of many more who remain
unaccounted for
